$$Ahora, para $\lambda_1 = 5$ $$\begin{pmatrix}-1-(-5) & 0 & 0 \\0 & 6 - (5) & -2 \\0 & -2 & 9 -(5)\end{pmatrix} \sim$$ $$\begin{pmatrix}-6 & 0 & 0 \\0 & 1 & -2 \\0 & -2 & 4\end{pmatrix} \sim \begin{pmatrix}1 & 0 & 0 \\0 & 1 & -2 \\0 & 0 & 0\end{pmatrix}$$ $$\begin{pmatrix}1 & 0 & 0 \\0 & 1 & -2 \\0 & 0 & 0\end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix}x \\y \\z\end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix}x \\y - 2z \\0\end{pmatrix} =$$ $$\begin{pmatrix}0 \\0 \\0\end{pmatrix} \Rightarrow x = 0, y - 2z = 0 \Rightarrow y = 2z$$ $$
$$El espacio característico $$E(\lambda_2 = 5) = \{(0,2z,z) \mid z \in \mathbb R\}$$ $$
$$Una base es $\{(0,2,1)\}$ $$
$$Para $\lambda_3 = 10$ $$\begin{pmatrix}-1 -(10) & 0 & 0 \\0 & 6 - (10) & -2 \\0 & -2 & 9 - (10)\end{pmatrix} \sim$$ $$\begin{pmatrix}-11 & 0 & 0 \\0 & -4 & -2 \\0 & -2 & -1\end{pmatrix} \sim \begin{pmatrix}1 & 0 & 0 \\0 & -4 & -2 \\0 & -2 & -1\end{pmatrix} \sim$$ $$\begin{pmatrix}1 & 0 & 0 \\0 & -2 & -1 \\0 & -4 & -2\end{pmatrix} \sim \begin{pmatrix}1 & 0 & 0 \\0 & -2 & -1 \\ 0 & 0 & 0\end{pmatrix}$$ $$\begin{pmatrix}1 & 0 & 0 \\0 & -2 & -1 \\0 & 0 & 0\end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix}x \\y \\z\end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix}x \\-2y - z \\0\end{pmatrix} = $$ $$\begin{pmatrix}0 \\0 \\0 \end{pmatrix} \Rightarrow x = 0, -2y - z = 0 \Rightarrow z = -2y$$ $$
$$El espacio característico $$E(\lambda_3 = 10) = \{(0,y,-2y) \mid z \in \mathbb R\}$$ $$
$$Una base es $\{(0,1,-2)\}$ $$
$$La unión de las bases es: $$\{(1,0,0)(0,2,1)(0,1,-2)\}$$ $$
$$Utilizando el producto interno usual para calcular la norma. $$\|(1,0,0)\| = \sqrt{(1,0,0) \mid (1,0,0)}$$ $$= \sqrt{1 + 0 + 0} = 1$$ $$\|(0,2,1)\| = \sqrt{(0,2,1)(0,2,1)}$$ $$= \sqrt{0 + 2^2 + 1^2} = \sqrt{5}$$ $$\|(0,1,-2)\| = \sqrt{(0,1,-2)(0,1,-2)}$$ $$= \sqrt{0 + 1^2 + (-2)^2} = \sqrt{5}$$ $$
$$Una base ortonormal es: $$B = \{(1,0,0), \frac{1}{\sqrt{5}}(0,2,1),\frac{1}{\sqrt{5}}(0,1,-2)\}$$ $$
$$Una matriz diagonalizable es: $$P = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 0 & 0 \\0 & \frac{1}{\sqrt{5}} & \frac{2}{\sqrt{5}} \\0 & -\frac{2}{\sqrt{5}} & \frac{1}{\sqrt{5}}\end{bmatrix}$$ $$
$$Dicha matriz es ortogonal, el determinante es igual a 1. Si $A = PDP^{T}$ la descomposición espectral es: $$A = -1u_1u_{1}^{T} + 10u_{2}u_{2}^{T} + 5u_3u_{3}^{T}$$ $$u_{1}u_{1}^{T} = \begin{bmatrix}1 \\0 \\0\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}1 & 0 & 0\end{bmatrix}$$ $$= \begin{bmatrix}1 & 0 & 0 \\0 & 0 & 0 \\0 & 0 & 0\end{bmatrix}$$ $$u_{2}u_{2}^{T} = \begin{bmatrix}0 \\ \frac{1}{\sqrt{5}} \\-\frac{2}{\sqrt{5}}\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}0 & \frac{1}{\sqrt{5}} & -\frac{2}{\sqrt{5}}\end{bmatrix}$$ $$= \begin{bmatrix}0 & 0 & 0 \\0 & \frac{1}{5} & -\frac{2}{5} \\0 & -\frac{2}{5} & \frac{4}{5}\end{bmatrix}$$ $$u_{3}u_{3}^{T} = \begin{bmatrix}0 \\ \frac{2}{\sqrt{5}} \\ \frac{1}{\sqrt{5}}\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}o & \frac{2}{\sqrt{5}} & \frac{1}{\sqrt{5}}\end{bmatrix}$$ $$= \begin{bmatrix}0 & 0 & 0 \\0 & \frac{4}{5} & \frac{2}{5} \\0 & \frac{2}{5} & \frac{1}{5}\end{bmatrix}$$ $$
$$Sustituyendo en $$A = -1u_{1}u_{1}^{T} + 10u_{2}u_{2}^{T} + 5u_{3}u_{3}^{T}$$ $$A = -1\begin{bmatrix}1 & 0 & 0 \\0 & 0 & 0 \\0 & 0 & 0\end{bmatrix} + 10\begin{bmatrix}0 & 0 & 0 \\0 & \frac{1}{5} & -\frac{2}{5} \\0 & -\frac{2}{5} & \frac{4}{5}\end{bmatrix}$$ $$+5\begin{bmatrix}0 & 0 & 0 \\0 & \frac{4}{5} & \frac{2}{5} \\0 & \frac{2}{5} & \frac{1}{5}\end{bmatrix}$$ $$= \begin{bmatrix}-1 & 0 & 0 \\0 & 6 & -2 \\0 & -2 & 9\end{bmatrix}$$

explanation:
La curva $16x + 4xy + 6y^2 = 1$ se puede representar como: $$Ax^2 + Bxy + Cy^2 = 1$$ $$(x^{'} y^{'}) = \begin{pmatrix}A & \frac{B}{2} \\ \frac{B}{2} & C\end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix}x \\y\end{pmatrix}$$ $$= Ax^2 + \frac{B}{2}xy + \frac{B}{2}xy + Cy^2$$ $$
$$La matriz asociada es: $$M(T) = \begin{pmatrix}A & \frac{B}{2} \\ \frac{B}{2} & C\end{pmatrix}$$ $$M(T) = \begin{pmatrix}6 & 2 \\2 & 6\end{pmatrix}$$ $$
$$Los valores característicos del operador lineal se calculan como sigue: $$M(T) - \lambda I = \begin{pmatrix}6 - \lambda & 2 \\2 & 6 - \lambda\end{pmatrix}$$ $$((6 - \lambda)(6 - \lambda))- 4 = (6 - \lambda)^2 - 4$$ $$(6 - \lambda + 2)(6 - \lambda - 2) = 0$$ $$(8 - \lambda)(4 - \lambda) = 0$$ $$\lambda_1 = 8, \lambda_2 = 4$$ $$
$$La cónica es $$\lambda_1x^{'2} + \lambda_2y^{'2} = 1 \Rightarrow 8x^{'2} + 4y^{'2} = 1$$ $$
$$ $\therefore$ es una elipse.
